intro: Baphia gracilipedicellata, commonly known as the slender-fruited baphia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, pod-like fruits and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in racemes. Baphia gracilipedicellata is adapted to dry climates and is often found in savannah or woodland habitats.
